author: Dave Michaels
title: SEC Rejects Sale of Chicago Stock Exchange
text:
WASHINGTON—The Securities and Exchange Commission on Thursday rejected the sale of the Chicago Stock Exchange to a group that would have included Chinese investors, capping a two-year battle over a deal that sparked political opposition in Congress.
The SEC’s commissioners voted against the transaction six months after the agency’s staff recommended approving the sale. The decision is a rare move by the SEC to choose who isn’t allowed to control a U.S. stock exchange, even one that handles less than 1% of trading volume.
